intro: Jussiaea latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. It is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soils. Jussiaea latifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
